comment: Not a good professor. It's almost like she doesn't know how to teach. She goes through problems during class and is pretty unengaged and boring. I took the same course with a different professor (Sarmast, Mehdi) the semester after I withdrew from Rossi's class and it was like taking a completely different course.

Professor Rossi is a great professor, and her class is easy to do well in. The course is a combination of tests, quizzes, labs, and homework assignments. There is also a final project instead of a final exam. She teaches well and is very available outside of class, I definitely recommend.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Everything was pretty straight forward up until the last unit. As long as you pay attention, you'll get an easy A. The class is very easy. filled with homework, lab's, and tests. Prof. Rossi grades very nicely and wants you to pass. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK. not used once.

Her lectures put me to sleep. I never learned from the lecture, only from the book. Her test 2 average was a 51 because she based it on practice problems modified into the test questions, so if you didn't do the practice, you failed. The practice problems were given to us a week after the test, and the test problems did not resemble coursework.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She was 'OK'. Class was boring, and monotone. She uses teams and records so you can review as needed. She does have a daily attendance problem so attendance is mandatory. I have 0 coding experience and this class was a breeze. She allows a 1 page cheat sheet for labs/tests. My gripes- Quizzes were done in D2L and not MATLAB. Unclear HW / Typos

Professor Rossi is quite good at teaching MATLAB. She gives videos to watch every week to understand the program well, and also goes over the concepts in class to give a clear understanding of the program. However, the student must pay attention in class to learn the program well and to do good on tests. Class has 3 tests, 4 labs, and a case study.

To give you an idea: this is the only class I have ever failed in my life... and it's on course material so easy as coding. Zero leniency, grades like its a year 4 course, assigns busy work in COLLEGE. I passed Calc III with a 97 with Berman (almost only proof-based tests) to give you an idea of how ridiculous this course is. Wrst tcher I've taken.
The one thing you should be aware of is her clear disgust for existing at KSU.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: MATLAB for ME engineers? Pick another. She thought it was best to make this class partially-asynchronous, which means learn everything on your own time, and do 4 practice problems the whole class. She doesn't mind questions and is helpful, but for what could've been a stupid easy programming class she made it more difficult than needed. Don't recom

She's a nice person, but she doesn't know how to teach. She uses Powerpoint for notes and speaks in a monotone voice. You learn more from doing the homework than lecture. Thermodynamics is important and is the basis of heat transfer. Make sure you can teach yourself before taking the course with her.
Pretty much, whole class time will be definitions and little problem-solving. If you want to pass this class, you have to work hard on your self. No curve and no extra credit. Challenge yourself.

Dr. Rossi is an excellent professor. She is very knowledgeable about MATLAB and also makes herself very available for help outside of class. She gives very good feedback and I learned a lot. I would definitely recommend taking her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dont take her. The First exam class average was a 68%. Havent gotten the final yet. Her tests are worth 25 and 35%. She says she gives partial but she grades stupid hard. Presence is a grade. Theres a quiz every class. Only reason I didnt fail is because of good ole chegg. Heat Transfer is the heaviest topic on the FE exam & Ive been robbed.
